meanings.definition: A person who supervises students during an examination.
meanings.sent1: During the test, the invigilators made sure no one cheated.
meanings.sent2: The invigilators were responsible for ensuring a fair exam environment.
meanings.sent3: The invigilators joked that they had eyes in the back of their heads.
meanings.sent4: The invigilators were like guardians protecting the integrity of the exam.
meanings.sent5: The invigilators' presence helped students focus on their papers.

meanings.definition: To watch over or supervise students during an examination.
meanings.sent1: Teachers invigilating the exam walked around the room quietly.
meanings.sent2: It is important to invigilate exams to prevent cheating.
meanings.sent3: The robot invigilated the test with precision and accuracy.
meanings.sent4: She invigilated the students with a keen eye for any suspicious behavior.
meanings.sent5: Invigilating the exam required patience and attentiveness.
